Author: dimxy#2587

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
Here is examples of rpcs in the latest version:
first marmarareceive call:
./komodo-cli -ac_name=MARMARAXY2 marmarareceive 02d4567e8ed8d1eab2830df553cbddfe4cf17a8de73d080c716adff6ee820ce1f1 0.202 MARMARA 20 '{"avalcount":"1"}'

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
marmaraissue call:
./komodo-cli -ac_name=MARMARAXY2 marmaraissue 03aadb18f5ddc369b15c67162b342d5db2d67e0ad0a87fac39bf8a174384e1d0ac '{"avalcount":"1", "BlockageAmount":"10000", "autoinsurance":"true", "autosettlement":"true", "EscrowOn":"true"}' e8ddc980a0ad1e05eea9c4a3c7336ede807101dd464b42b13037169845086722

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
subsequent marmarareceive call:
./komodo-cli -ac_name=MARMARAXY2 marmarareceive 03aadb18f5ddc369b15c67162b342d5db2d67e0ad0a87fac39bf8a174384e1d0ac cd11de5a397f87d9c712cc76259f015b7317066b546e43428e28aec1638e973a '{"avalcount":"1"}'

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
marmaratransfer call:
./komodo-cli -ac_name=MARMARAXY2 marmaratransfer 02bc47ce434b32a34115348938f4eecb7647109a1e16a144f32ebae9e4398c5c3e '{"avalcount":"1"}' 323c0002ff77237e1d0a1bdb13e3c7197a47840844ffa4adc2a7b0afb562a1b1

The point is the new parameters are added in JSON object (in apostrophes)
Also duplicated params amount, currency, mature are needed only in the first marmarareceive call

Author: dimxy#2587

--------------
Please be aware that those new parameters (avalcount EscrowOn, BlockageAmount,... ) are not working yet
They are supposed to be implemented in V2
(I believe  we are still working on V1,  the params were added for the rpc compatibility with V2)

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: I was with @Paro and @zekigulen yesterday. They are making black box tests. I also joined in some of the tests personally. Let me try to translate our concern @dimxy and @jl777c .  We made tests with the codes before the addition of blank parameters from Version 2. I think there is a fundamental problem as far as I  see from test results. We need to clarify it. When someone has coins in LCL, he/she should be staking 3x than normal activated. Now it seems to work like this. Suppose I have 40000 activated and no coin in LCL. It works with normal staking power. But supposse I have 10 coins only in LCL and I have 40000 in activated. And someone has  40000 coins in LCL but only 10 coins as activated. He can produce more even if the other person has more in LCL. I think it currently looks at the person if he/she has coins in LCL and prodcues from the activated ones not based on the LCL. LCL wallet address is only one address common to all and actually not stakeable.  Therefore, we don't encourage the real credit creators. People just need to lock something to get full 3x power of staking. If we summarize, we just need to lock something  in LCL to have 3x staking. The 3x staking is based on activated ones and not the coins  in LCL. This is what we see from the system. I think the problem may be solved by making  a stakeable address such as  "myLCLAmount" similar to "myActivatedAmount". Both  "myLCLAmount" and "myActivatedAmount" should stake simulatenously according to their contents.  I think "myAmountOnActivatedAddress-old" may be deleted. It is not needed any more. It was used to collect the latest 16 activated ones when we were having activated coins  between 3 months to 2 years. Now all coins are activated at a maximum height. I don't know if I could explain the concern well ?@Paro

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
If we are concerned with that low LCL amount produces small number of blocks (and big amount of activated coins will consume most of the blocks generation) we might disable staking on activated and enable only on LCL coins. But if the total LCL amount for that whole chain is low the staking might be unstable.
Alternatively we could change the  multiplier for LCL

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: myAmountOnActivatedAddress-old is temp value, for developer to check if opreturn is correct and now activated coins would  be lost. It will be deleted, please dont pay attention to it

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
I understand you can see that seems the activated coins produce more generated blocks than locked-in-loop.
But as JL wrote we need probably several week for staking to stabilize. So it is too early to make conclusion now that LCL coins is incorrect

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 40000 compared to 10 is 4000x more coins, so you would need a 4000x ratio to compensate

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: @Paro I think we need to look at the coding part to explain our concern. Black box tests are not enough.

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: the code is fully open. You might be concerned with LCL implementation. LCL is implemented as a shared account for the system to be able to spend it and redistribute amount between the endorsers (as the doc states). But each LCL utxo is marked with the pubkey who owns this part. So for staking only those utxo are picked up that are marked with the miner's pubkey. So this is a complete equivalent for myLCLaccount.

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
you could ask about any part of the code and I can clarify it.
Most of the code (rpc and helpers, opretun creation functions) is in cc/marmara.cpp.
Staking extensions are in komodo_bitcoind.h file
calling creation of miner's transactions is in miner.cpp file, 
this creation func, which calls MarmaraRunAutoSettlement, is in komodo_gateway.h

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: Do the staking extensions in komodo_bitcoind.h  also include LCL part?

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: the algorithm of adding staking utxo is in cc/marmara.cpp, MarmaraGetStakingUtxos which is called from the komodo_bitcoind.h

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
it enumerates both activated utxos then LCL utxos for the mypubkey (which is miner's pk)
Applying of the multipliers is in the cc/marmara.cpp MarmaraGetStakeMultiplier function, this function is called back from komodo_bitcoind.h, func komodo_txtime2

(komodo_bitcoind is a common src file, it itself contains little app logic and provides only callbacks which extend the basic komodo functionality for specific marmara features. The logic is in marmara.cpp)

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
We can do such estimations, yes. 
For the present test we cannot expect solid coin generation based on LCL amount until the chain stabilizes.
As I understand JL, it might take weeks to stabilize.
Plus, it is important what amount is locked, because if I have 10 LCL but another endorser has 4000 activated, I would have too low chances even with 3x amplifier
